archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
name: Zarzuela de Mariscos with Portuguese Saffron Rice
description: A Catalan-style seafood stew enriched with a nut-and-bread picada, served alongside fragrant Portuguese saffron rice. A family centerpiece with layered Iberian flavors.
prep_steps: Slice 2 large onions and 2 bell peppers; thinly slice 6 cloves garlic (reserve 1 extra clove for the picada).
Cut 600g fish fillets into large chunks; pat dry.
Rinse mussels and prawns (if needed) and drain seafood mix.
Chop a small onion and mince 2 cloves garlic for the rice; chop parsley; cut lemon into wedges.
Place a pinch of saffron in 1/2 cup warm water to bloom (for the stew); place another pinch in 1/4 cup warm water (for the rice).
Toast 2 slices bread on a tray in the oven until crisp (5–7 min); spread 1/3 cup nuts on the same tray to lightly toast (3–5 min). Cool.
Crumble toasted bread and nuts with 1 raw garlic clove and a pinch of salt using a processor or by pounding in a bag with a rolling pin to make a coarse picada.
cook_steps: Set a large wide pot over medium heat with 3 tbsp olive oil. Soften sliced onions and bell peppers with a pinch of salt for 10–12 min.
Stir in sliced garlic (6 cloves) for 1 min, then add 2 tbsp tomato paste and 1 tsp paprika; cook 1–2 min.
Add 1 cup white wine; simmer 2–3 min to reduce.
Add 800g diced tomatoes, 2 bay leaves, the bloomed saffron (with its water), 2 tsp fish stock concentrate and 3 cups water. Simmer 15 min; taste and season with salt and black pepper.
Gently add fish fillets; simmer 3–4 min. Add seafood mix, mussels, and prawns; cover and cook 5–7 min until prawns are pink and mussels open. Discard any unopened mussels.
Stir the picada into the stew to thicken; simmer 2–3 min more. Finish with chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon. Keep warm on low.
For the rice: In a medium pot over medium heat, warm 2 tbsp olive oil. Sauté the small chopped onion 3–4 min; add minced garlic (2 cloves) for 30 sec.
Stir in 2 cups spanish rice to coat for 1–2 min. Add 4.5 cups chicken stock, the bloomed saffron (with its water), and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil.
Reduce to low, cover, and cook 16–18 min until rice is tender and liquid absorbed. Rest 5 min off heat, then fluff.
Serve the zarzuela in a wide platter with lemon wedges; ladle Portuguese saffron rice alongside.

ingredients.preparation: sliced for stew; small onion finely chopped for rice
6 sliced for stew, 2 minced for rice, 1 raw for picada
bloomed in warm water, divided for stew and rice
for stew base (plus small amounts to bloom saffron)
